name: Tomato Gothsu
history: Tomato Gothsu is a popular South Indian dish, often served as an accompaniment with idli, dosa, or pongal. It originates from Tamil Nadu and is known for its simplicity and tangy flavor, primarily derived from tomatoes.
description: Tomato Gothsu is a tangy and mildly spiced dish made primarily with tomatoes, along with a simple tempering of spices. It's a smooth, soup-like dish that pairs well with various South Indian breakfast items and is favored for its easy preparation and comforting taste.

instructions.title: Prepare the Tomatoes
instructions.description: In a pan, cook the chopped tomatoes with green chilies, tamarind paste, and a cup of water until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.

instructions.title: Mash the Mixture
instructions.description: Once the tomatoes are cooked, mash them to create a smooth consistency.

instructions.title: Temper the Spices
instructions.description: In a separate pan, heat oil. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, asafoetida, and curry leaves. When the mustard seeds start to splutter, add this tempering to the tomato mixture.

instructions.title: Simmer
instructions.description: Bring the entire mixture to a simmer and add salt to taste. Cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Tomato Gothsu hot with idli, dosa, or pongal.

tips: Ensure the tomatoes are well-cooked for a smooth texture in the gothsu.
Adjust the amount of green chilies based on your spice preference.
variations: Add a pinch of jaggery or sugar to balance the tanginess of the tomatoes.
You can also add a small piece of ginger for additional flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on the stove over low heat until warm.

presentationTips: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves for added color and aroma.
Serve in a traditional earthenware bowl for an authentic touch.
